citations.title: FORD ACCELERATES ELECTRIFICATION PROMISE ...
citations.summary: Ford plans to install 1,000 charging points at its facilities over the next three years and is a founding member of the IONITY consortium, which aims to establish 400 fast-charging stations in Europe with a capacity of 350 kW by year-end. This infrastructure will significantly reduce charging times for electric vehicles, with the Mustang Mach-E capable of gaining up to 57 miles of range in just 10 minutes at an IONITY station and charging from 10% to 80% in approximately 38 minutes on a DC fast charger. Additionally, the Ford Connected Wallbox will provide up to five times the charging power of a standard domestic socket for home use.

citations.title: All-New Ford Mondeo Delivers Widest Ever Range of ...
citations.summary: The all-new Ford Mondeo features an Active Thermal Management System that optimizes warm-up times by selectively cooling components, alongside a variable oil pump that minimizes parasitic losses through on-demand oil pressure adjustments. Both the 150PS and 180PS 2.0 TDCi engines can be paired with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed PowerShift automatic transmission, achieving ECOnetic specifications of 107g/km CO2 emissions and 68.9mpg fuel efficiency.

citations.title: Ford Reveals New Electrified Vehicle Line-Up at 'Go ...
citations.summary: Ford is advancing its all-electric vehicle lineup with next-generation connectivity for over-the-air updates and is establishing charging solutions, including participation in the IONITY consortium to create 400 fast-charging stations in Europe with a capacity of 350 kW. The upcoming Mustang-inspired electric SUV, set to launch in 2020, will offer a driving range of 600 km (over 370 miles) based on WLTP standards and feature fast-charging capabilities. Additionally, the Ford Transit Smart Energy Concept minibus is being utilized to enhance energy efficiency and driving range for electrified vehicles.

citations.title: Ford Engineers Discover Best Way to Improve Electric ...
citations.summary: Ford engineers, as part of the CEVOLVER project, conducted research on heat management in electric vehicles (EVs) to enhance vehicle design and software updates. The findings emphasized the importance of maintaining internal temperature, particularly in delivery vans where frequent door openings lead to rapid heat loss. The project highlighted the potential of using a heat exchanger to recover waste heat from the electric drive, thereby improving energy efficiency, extending range, and reducing operational costs.

citations.title: Ford Pro Boosts Segment-Leading E-Transit | Ford of Europe
citations.summary: Ford Pro has enhanced the E-Transit commercial vehicle by introducing an extended range option that includes a new 89 kWh battery, allowing it to travel up to 402 kmâ€”an increase of 28 percent. The vehicle features a standard vapour-injected heat pump, similar to that used in the E-Transit Custom, which improves energy efficiency and optimizes range in low temperatures. Additionally, the E-Transit now supports faster AC and DC charging capabilities.

citations.title: Ford Hits CO2 Manufacturing Emissions Reduction Target ...
citations.summary: Ford, in partnership with BMW Group, Daimler AG, and Volkswagen Group (including Audi and Porsche), co-founded IONITY to establish a fast-charging network for electric vehicles across Europe. The initiative aims to construct 400 fast-charging stations by 2020, each with a charging capacity of 350 kW, significantly reducing charging times compared to current systems. As part of this effort, 20 stations are being developed in various European countries.
